alert.note: Alert for Allamakee; Clayton; Fayette; Howard; Winneshiek (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 31 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Slippery To Hazardous Travel In Snow Showers This Morning... Bands of snow, with pockets of moderate to heavy snow, will rotate across and through the local area through mid to late morning. Visibilities in the heavy snow will quickly drop to 1/2 mile. Additional snowfall of up to 1" is expected, mostly on cold and grassy surfaces. In addition, winds will gust from 30 to 40 mph at times. Travel has become slippery to hazardous this morning, mostly across portions of southeast Minnesota and western into north- central Wisconsin. Bridges and overpasses are especially treacherous with melting snow refreezing...resulting in icy conditions. Numerous accidents and slide offs have already occurred this morning. If you must travel, be prepared for the winter driving conditions...especially across bridges and overpasses. Take it slow and allow for ample time to reach your destination.
